intro: Asperella gracilis, commonly known as the slender asperella, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent tubular corolla. Asperella gracilis is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth.
